sectiondef.header: Use this values as mode parameter for
Use this values as access parameter for

detaileddescription.para: Create new file and delete if existing
Open an existing file, create it if not existing

sectiondef.header: Use this values as whence parameter for

description.para: If something goes wrong, one of this values will be returned.

sectiondef.header: Constant used to define sector structure.

description.para: Do not change this unless you know what you are doing.

detaileddescription.para: Actual sector size. Use only power of 2
The actual valid data may be as much as this, since the signature is coded on 32 bytes
Cipher block algorithm requires to encrypt data whose size is a multiple of this block size
The largest multiple of SEFILE_BLOCK_SIZE that can fit in SEFILE_SECTOR_DATA_SIZE
The amount of Overhead created by SEFILE_SECTOR::len and SEFILE_SECTOR::signature
Data struct used to access encrypted files

briefdescription.para: This function creates a new secure environment, by allocating statically the parameters needed by the following functions.

detaileddescription.para:
s
Contains the pointer to the se3_session structure that must be used during the session.
keyID
Contains the ID number of the key that must be used during the session.
crypto
Contains the id to specify which algorithm to use. See AlgorithmAvail, it can be SE3_ALGO_MAX + 1 if you don't know which algorithm to choose. See error values for error list.
All the data passed to this function must be allocated and filled with valid data. Once secure_init succeed it is possible to destroy these data, since a copy has been made. N.B. Remember to call the secure_finit function to deallocate these data once you have finished.

briefdescription.para: This function can be called only after the secure_init() function and give to the user the possibility to overwrite the Environment variables with new ones.

detaileddescription.para:
s
Contains the pointer to the se3_session structure that must be used during the session. Can be NULL.
keyID
keyID Contains the ID number of the key that must be used during the session. Can be -1.
crypto
Contains the id to specify which algorithm to use.
The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list. Parameters from 1 to 3 can be a NULL pointer or '-1' value, if all parameters are NULL (or '-1' in case of keyID) the function is a No-Operation one.

briefdescription.para: This function deallocate the structures defined by the secure_init(). Should be called at the end of a session. No parameters are needed;.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function computes the encrypted name of the file specified at position path and its length.

parameterdescription.para: It can be absolute or relative but it can not be a directory. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.
Already allocate string where the encrypted filename should be stored.
Pointer to an allocated uint16_t where the length of the encrypted filename is stored.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function opens a secure file and create a SEFILE_FHANDLE that can be used in future.

parameterdescription.para: Specify the absolute/relative path where to retrieve the file to open. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.
The pointer in which the file handle to the opened file is placed after a success, NULL in case of failure.
The mode in which the file should be opened. See mode parameter for secure_open.
Define if the file should be created or it should already exist. See access parameter for secure_open.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function creates a new secure file and creates a SEFILE_FHANDLE that can be used in future. If the file already exists, it is overwritten with an empty one, all previous data are lost.

parameterdescription.para: Specify the absolute/relative path where to create the file. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.
The pointer in which the file handle to the new opened file is placed after a success, NULL in case of failure.
The mode in which the file should be created. See mode parameter for secure_open.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function writes the characters given by dataIn to the encrypted file hFile. Before writing them, dataIn is encrypted according to the environmental parameters.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to an already opened file to be written.
The string of characters that have to be written.
The length, in bytes, of the data that have to be written.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function reads from hFile bytesRead characters out of dataOut_len correctly decrypted ones and stores them in dataOut string.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to an already opened file to be read.
An already allocated array of characters where to store data read.
Number of characters we want to read.
Number of effective characters read, MUST NOT BE NULL.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function is used to move correctly the file pointer.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to the file to manipulate.
Amount of character we want to move.
Pointer to a int32_t variable where the final position is stored, MUST NOT BE NULL.
According to this parameter we can choose if we want to move from the file beginning, file ending or current file pointer position. See whence parameter for secure_seek.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function resizes the file pointed by hFile to size. If size is bigger than its current size the gap is filled with 0s.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to the file to manipulate.
New size of the file.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function releases resources related to hFile.

parameterdescription.para: The handle to the file we do not want to manipulate no more.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function identifies which encrypted files and encrypted directories are present in the directory pointed by path and writes them in list. It only recognizes the ones encrypted with the current environmental parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Absolute or relative path to the directory to browse. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.
Already allocated array where to store filenames and directory names. Each entry is separated by '\0'.
Pointer to a uint32_t used to stored total number of characters written in list.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function is used to get the total logic size of an encrypted file pointed by path. Logic size will always be smaller than physical size.

parameterdescription.para: Absolute or relative path the file. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.
Pointer to an allocated uint32_t variable where will be stored the file size.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function creates a directory with an encrypted name.

parameterdescription.para: Absolute or relative path of the new directory. No encrypted directory are allowed inside the path.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This function is used in case we want to be sure that the physical file is synced with the OS buffers.

parameterdescription.para: Handle to the secure file to be synced.

simplesect.para: The function returns a (uint16_t) '0' in case of success. See error values for error list.

briefdescription.para: This file includes constants, return values and public functions used for implementing a secure file system.

detaileddescription.para:
Francesco Giavatto, Nicolò Maunero, Giulio Scalia
17/09/2016 In this library you will find wrappers to common OS system calls, in order to manage encrypted files using the SECube Board. In this files are also reported the constant used as parameter and all the possible return values.
